javadoc: DomainObject is the interface that must be supported by data objects that are persistent. DomainObjects maintain an association with a DomainFile. A DomainObject that has never been saved will have a null DomainFile.

methods.javadoc: Returns whether the object has changed.
methods.name: isChanged
methods.comment: Returns whether the object has changed.

methods.javadoc:
Set the temporary state of this object.
 If this object is temporary, the isChanged() method will
 always return false.  The default temporary state is false.
@param state if true object is marked as temporary
methods.name: setTemporary
methods.comment:
Set the temporary state of this object.
 If this object is temporary, the isChanged() method will
 always return false.  The default temporary state is false.

params.name: state
params.comment: if true object is marked as temporary

methods.javadoc: Returns true if this object has been marked as Temporary.
methods.name: isTemporary
methods.comment: Returns true if this object has been marked as Temporary.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if changes are permitted.
methods.name: isChangeable
methods.comment: Returns true if changes are permitted.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this object can be saved; a read-only file
 cannot be saved.
methods.name: canSave
methods.comment:
Returns true if this object can be saved; a read-only file
 cannot be saved.

methods.name: save
methods.comment: Saves changes to the DomainFile.

params.name: comment
params.comment: comment used for new version

params.name: monitor
params.comment: monitor that shows the progress of the save

throws.comment:
thrown if there was an error accessing this
 domain object

thrown if the user canceled the save
 operation

methods.name: saveToPackedFile
methods.comment: Saves (i.e., serializes) the current content to a packed file.

params.name: outputFile
params.comment: packed output file

params.name: monitor
params.comment: progress monitor

methods.javadoc:
Notify the domain object that the specified consumer is no longer using it.
 When the last consumer invokes this method, the domain object will be closed 
 and will become invalid.
@param consumer the consumer (e.g., tool, plugin, etc) of the domain object 
 previously established with the addConsumer method.
methods.name: release
methods.comment:
Notify the domain object that the specified consumer is no longer using it.
 When the last consumer invokes this method, the domain object will be closed 
 and will become invalid.

params.name: consumer
params.comment:
the consumer (e.g., tool, plugin, etc) of the domain object 
 previously established with the addConsumer method.

methods.javadoc:
Adds a listener for this object.
@param dol listener notified when any change occurs to this domain object
methods.name: addListener
methods.comment: Adds a listener for this object.

params.name: dol
params.comment: listener notified when any change occurs to this domain object

methods.javadoc:
Remove the listener for this object.
@param dol listener
methods.name: removeListener
methods.comment: Remove the listener for this object.

params.name: dol
params.comment: listener

methods.name: addCloseListener
methods.comment:
Adds a listener that will be notified when this DomainObject is closed.  This is meant
 for clients to have a chance to cleanup, such as reference removal.

params.name: listener
params.comment: the reference to add

methods.javadoc:
Removes the given close listener.
@param listener the listener to remove.
methods.name: removeCloseListener
methods.comment: Removes the given close listener.

params.name: listener
params.comment: the listener to remove.

methods.name: createPrivateEventQueue
methods.comment: Creates a private event queue that can be flushed independently from the main event queue.

params.name: listener
params.comment: the listener to be notified of domain object events.

params.name: maxDelay
params.comment: the time interval (in milliseconds) used to buffer events.

return.comment: a unique identifier for this private queue.

methods.name: removePrivateEventQueue
methods.comment: Removes the specified private event queue

params.name: id
params.comment: the id of the queue to remove.

return.comment: true if the id represents a valid queue that was removed.

methods.javadoc:
Returns a word or short phrase that best describes or categorizes
 the object in terms that a user will understand.
methods.name: getDescription
methods.comment:
Returns a word or short phrase that best describes or categorizes
 the object in terms that a user will understand.

methods.javadoc: Get the name of this domain object.
methods.name: getName
methods.comment: Get the name of this domain object.

methods.javadoc:
Set the name for this domain object.
@param name object name
methods.name: setName
methods.comment: Set the name for this domain object.

params.name: name
params.comment: object name

methods.javadoc:
Get the domain file for this domain object.
@return the associated domain file
methods.name: getDomainFile
methods.comment: Get the domain file for this domain object.

methods.name: addConsumer
methods.comment:
Adds the given object as a consumer.  The release method must be invoked
 with this same consumer instance when this domain object is no longer in-use.

params.name: consumer
params.comment: domain object consumer

return.comment: false if this domain object has already been closed

methods.javadoc:
Returns the list of consumers on this domainObject
@return the list of consumers.
methods.name: getConsumerList
methods.comment: Returns the list of consumers on this domainObject

methods.name: isUsedBy
methods.comment: Returns true if the given consumer is using (has open) this domain object.

params.name: consumer
params.comment: the object to test to see if it is a consumer of this domain object.

return.comment: true if the given consumer is using (has open) this domain object;

methods.javadoc:
If true, domain object change events are sent. If false, no events are sent.

NOTE: disabling events could cause plugins to be out of sync!

NOTE: when re-enabling events, an event will be sent to the system to signal that every listener should update. @param enabled true means to enable events
methods.name: setEventsEnabled
methods.comment:
If true, domain object change events are sent. If false, no events are sent.
 
 
 NOTE: disabling events could cause plugins to be out of sync!
 
 
 NOTE: when re-enabling events, an event will be sent to the system to signal that
       every listener should update.

params.name: enabled
params.comment: true means to enable events

methods.name: isSendingEvents
methods.comment:
Returns true if this object is sending out events as it is changed.  The default is
 true.  You can change this value by calling #setEventsEnabled(boolean).

methods.javadoc: Makes sure all pending domainEvents have been sent.
methods.name: flushEvents
methods.comment: Makes sure all pending domainEvents have been sent.

methods.javadoc:
Flush events from the specified event queue.
@param id the id specifying the event queue to be flushed.
methods.name: flushPrivateEventQueue
methods.comment: Flush events from the specified event queue.

params.name: id
params.comment: the id specifying the event queue to be flushed.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if a modification lock can be obtained on this
 domain object.  Care should be taken with using this method since
 this will not prevent another thread from modifying the domain object.
methods.name: canLock
methods.comment:
Returns true if a modification lock can be obtained on this
 domain object.  Care should be taken with using this method since
 this will not prevent another thread from modifying the domain object.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if the domain object currenly has a modification lock enabled.
methods.name: isLocked
methods.comment: Returns true if the domain object currenly has a modification lock enabled.

methods.name: lock
methods.comment:
Attempt to obtain a modification lock on the domain object.  Multiple locks
 may be granted on this domain object, although all lock owners must release their
 lock in a timely fashion.

params.name: reason
params.comment: very short reason for requesting lock

return.comment:
true if lock obtained successfully, else false which indicates that a
 modification is in process.

methods.name: forceLock
methods.comment: Cancels any previous lock and aquires it.

params.name: rollback
params.comment: if true, any changes in made with the previous lock should be discarded.

params.name: reason
params.comment: very short reason for requesting lock

methods.javadoc: Release a modification lock previously granted with the lock method.
methods.name: unlock
methods.comment: Release a modification lock previously granted with the lock method.

methods.javadoc:
Returns all properties lists contained by this domain object.
@return all property lists contained by this domain object.
methods.name: getOptionsNames
methods.comment: Returns all properties lists contained by this domain object.

return.comment: all property lists contained by this domain object.

methods.javadoc:
Get the property list for the given name.
@param propertyListName name of property list
methods.name: getOptions
methods.comment: Get the property list for the given name.

params.name: propertyListName
params.comment: name of property list

methods.javadoc: Returns true if this domain object has been closed as a result of the last release
methods.name: isClosed
methods.comment: Returns true if this domain object has been closed as a result of the last release

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if the user has exclusive access to the domain object.  Exclusive access means
 either the object is not shared or the user has an exclusive checkout on the object.
methods.name: hasExclusiveAccess
methods.comment:
Returns true if the user has exclusive access to the domain object.  Exclusive access means
 either the object is not shared or the user has an exclusive checkout on the object.

methods.name: getMetadata
methods.comment:
Returns a map containing all the stored metadata associated with this domain object.  The map
 contains key,value pairs and are ordered by their insertion order.

return.comment: a map containing all the stored metadata associated with this domain object.

methods.name: getModificationNumber
methods.comment:
Returns a long value that gets incremented every time a change, undo, or redo takes place.
 Useful for implementing a lazy caching system.

return.comment: a long value that is incremented for every change to the program.

name: DomainObject
comment:
DomainObject is the interface that must be supported by
 data objects that are persistent. DomainObjects maintain an
 association with a DomainFile. A DomainObject that
 has never been saved will have a null DomainFile.

fields.javadoc: Object to synchronize on for undo/redo operations.
fields.name: undoLock
fields.comment: Object to synchronize on for undo/redo operations.

fields.javadoc: Event type generated when the domain object is saved.
fields.name: DO_OBJECT_SAVED
fields.comment: Event type generated when the domain object is saved.

fields.javadoc:
Event type generated when the domain file associated with
 the domain object changes.
fields.name: DO_DOMAIN_FILE_CHANGED
fields.comment:
Event type generated when the domain file associated with
 the domain object changes.

fields.javadoc: Event type generated when the object name changes.
fields.name: DO_OBJECT_RENAMED
fields.comment: Event type generated when the object name changes.

fields.javadoc: Event type generated when domain object is restored.
fields.name: DO_OBJECT_RESTORED
fields.comment: Event type generated when domain object is restored.

fields.javadoc: Event type generated when a property on this DomainObject is changed.
fields.name: DO_PROPERTY_CHANGED
fields.comment: Event type generated when a property on this DomainObject is changed.

fields.javadoc: Event type generated when this domain object is closed.
fields.name: DO_OBJECT_CLOSED
fields.comment: Event type generated when this domain object is closed.

fields.javadoc: Event type generated when a fatal error occurs which renders the domain object invalid.
fields.name: DO_OBJECT_ERROR
fields.comment: Event type generated when a fatal error occurs which renders the domain object invalid.
